valItem.desc: General purpose text division for all parts of parliamentary proceedings. The suggested values below are adapted from Akoma Ntoso. If needed, the @subtype attribute can be used for additional content classification.
Part of a debate relevant to addresses
Part of a debate containing adjournment notices
Part of a debate containing the administration of an oath
Part of a debate containing communications from the house
Part of a debate relevant to the declaration of votes
Part of a debate containing written statements by participants
Part of a debate containing resolutions
Part of a debate relevant to the notices of motions
Part of a debate containing oral statements by participants
Part of a debate relevant to the display of papers
Part of a debate relevant to petitions
Part of a debate containing prayers
Part of a debate relevant to procedural motions
Part of a debate relevant to points of order
Part of a debate containing written statements by participants
Part of a debate relevant to questions
Part of a debate containing resolutions
Part of a debate containing a roll call of individuals
Part of a debate containing written statements by participants
Description in the third person of events taking place in the meeting, e.g. "Mr X. takes the Chair".
Summaries of speeches that are individually not interesting, e.g. "Question put and agreed to".
Name, role and possible description of a person doing the speech
Outcome of a vote
The location of the speaker, who was not on the podium
Date of the session
Chairman of a meeting
Comment of parliamentary reporter
Date and time of the beginning and end of the debate
The presence of the members of parliament
Comments on the conduct of debates
